subject_terms_3: Photography Former Supreme Court (Singapore) St Andrew's Cathedral The Arts House at The Old Parliament Padang (Singapore)
physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is a bird's eye view of the Old Supreme Court in Singapore. There are several large colonial-style buildings in the center of the photograph. On the right, there is an open field. The photograph extends towards the urban landscape with numerous buildings in the background. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: George Lowe was a member of the British Expedition that saw Sir Edmund Hillary scale Mount Everest on 29 May 1953. In September that year, Lowe accompanied Hillary on a visit to Singapore to deliver their first Everest lecture outside of New Zealand at the Odeon Theatre to an audience of 1,620 schoolchildren. This photograph album, with the coat of arms of the City of Singapore in gilt on the cover, was presented to Lowe as a souvenir of his visit.
title_text: Photograph album presented to George Lowe as a souvenir of his visit to Singapore George Lowe album: Photograph of Old Supreme Court
